title: 107_s1517
content: The "Montgomery GI Bill Improvements Act of 2001" repeals pay reduction and the option not to enroll in basic educational assistance. The "Montgomery GI Bill Improvements Act of 2001" eliminates pay reduction and the choice not to enroll in basic educational assistance by amending various sections of title 38, United States Code. The Montgomery GI Bill Improvements Act of 2001 eliminates pay reduction for individuals under certain sections of title 38, United States Code, starting six months after enactment. The Montgomery GI Bill Improvements Act of 2001 eliminates pay reduction for individuals under specific sections of title 38, United States Code, starting six months after enactment. The amendments made by the Act will apply to individuals whose initial obligated period of active duty begins on or after the effective date. The Montgomery GI Bill Improvements Act of 2001 eliminates pay reduction for individuals under specific sections of title 38, United States Code, starting six months after enactment. Any obligations under subsection (b) or (c) will be fully satisfied as of the date of the first month after the six-month period. TRANSFER OF ENTITLEMENT TO EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE BY MEMBERS WITH 15 YEARS OF ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE. Transfer of Entitlement: Individuals with 15 years of active duty service can transfer their educational assistance entitlement to their spouse or children if they have completed at least 15 years of active duty service in the Armed Forces. Transfer of Entitlement: Individuals with 15 years of active duty service can transfer their educational assistance entitlement to their spouse or children. The individual must designate the dependent(s) and specify the percentage and period of transfer. The transfer can be done at any time regardless of the individual's current military status. An individual transferring entitlement under this section may modify or revoke the transfer at any time by submitting written notice to the Secretary. The use of transferred entitlement is charged against the individual's entitlement at a rate of one month for each month used. Dependents receiving transferred entitlement are entitled to educational assistance in the same manner and rate as the transferor. The transfer of entitlement under this section allows for the pursuit of educational requirements by dependents, including secondary school diploma completion. The administrative provisions of this chapter apply to the transferred entitlement, with the dependent treated as the eligible veteran. The transfer of entitlement under this section allows for dependents to receive assistance, with joint liability for overpayments. The Secretary will prescribe regulations for elections to modify or revoke transfers of entitlement. Transfer of entitlement to basic educational assistance for individuals with 15 years of active duty service will take effect six months after the enactment of the Act. The time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement is extended to a 20-year period for the All Volunteer Force Program and Educational Assistance for Selected Reserve. SEC. 5. BENEFIT FOR MEMBERS OF SELECTED RESERVE CALLED TO ACTIVE DUTY FOR MORE THAN ONE YEAR FOR CONTINGENCY OPERATION. Increased Benefit Under Educational Assistance for Selected Reserve members called to active duty for a contingency operation will receive a higher rate of educational assistance allowance based on the duration of their service. The educational assistance allowance for individuals pursuing different levels of education is determined based on their pursuit status, with varying amounts for full-time, three-quarter-time, half-time, and less than half-time pursuit. The educational assistance allowance for individuals pursuing different levels of education is determined based on their pursuit status. If a member's aggregate period on active duty for or in support of a contingency operation exceeds two years, specific amounts apply based on the duration of active duty. Within one year after completing active duty, individuals must serve at least four years in the Selected Reserve and participate in required training to qualify for educational assistance. Within one year after completing active duty, individuals must serve at least four years in the Selected Reserve and participate in required training to qualify for educational assistance. Section 3015(c) of title 10 is amended to include individuals entitled to educational assistance under section 3012 who serve on active duty for a contingency operation for a period of not less than one year.
